005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item;
007
008import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.datatype.IDataTypeAdapter;
009import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.ICollectionValue;
010import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.ISequence;
011
012import java.util.stream.Stream;
013
014import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
015
016public interface IItem extends ICollectionValue {
017
018  /**
019   * Get the item's "wrapped" value. This "wrapped" value may be:
020   * <ul>
021   * <li>In the case of an Assembly, a Java object representing the fields and
022   * flags of the assembly.</li>
023   * <li>In the case of a Field with flags, a Java object representing the field
024   * value and flags of the field.
025   * <li>In the case of a Field without flags or a flag, a Java type managed by a
026   * {@link IDataTypeAdapter} or a primitive type provided by the Java standard
027   * library.
028   * </ul>
029   *
030   * @return the value or {@code null} if the item has no available value
031   */
032  Object getValue();
033
034  /**
035   * Determine if the item has an associated value.
036   *
037   * @return {@code true} if the item has a non-{@code null} value or
038   *         {@code false} otherwise
039   */
040  default boolean hasValue() {
041    return getValue() != null;
042  }
043
044  @Override
045  default ISequence<?> asSequence() {
046    return ISequence.of(this);
047  }
048
049  @SuppressWarnings("null")
050  @Override
051  default Stream<? extends IItem> flatten() {
052    return Stream.of(this);
053  }
054
055  /**
056   * A visitor callback used to visit a variety of Metapath item types.
057   *
058   * @param visitor
059   *          the visitor to call back
060   */
061  void accept(@NonNull IItemVisitor visitor);
062}
